website_summaries.verdict: The unique style and comfort delivered by the Under Armour ArchiTech Futurist resonated well with consumers. Users also liked the stability of the footwear, its lightweight construction, and the sock-like fit of the upper. Though the ankle structure was applauded for the support it brought, the zipper in front caused discomfort for some users. The lack of more color options and the snug fit were also some of the negative points raised by shoppers. Despite some grievances with the shoes, it was still highly recommended because of its overall performance during workouts.
pros: The comfort offered by the Under Armour ArchiTech Futurist exceeded the expectations of many testers
The unique aesthetics of the merchandise impressed multiple consumers
The footwear was stable during lunges and lifts, as commented by a fair number of fitness aficionados
More than a few owners claimed that this model was true to size and fit like a sock
Several gym-goers commended the ankle structure as it provided support during workouts
The lightweight nature of the product delighted some buyers
The footwear was easy to wear, said a few users
A shopper stated that the overall construction of the trainer was well worth the price
cons: The Under Armour ArchiTech Futurist needed to be broken in
it caused foot pain when worn for extended periods of training when it was new, according to some reviewers
The zipper rubbed the front of the ankle area and caused chafing, complained a few wearers
A handful of critics wished that there were more colors available
A couple of people thought that the fit was too snug and would not accommodate broad feet
One commenter remarked that the double closure set-up made it difficult to put on and remove

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you know what you're getting
customer_reviews.text: No question this is a different looking shoe but I really like the style and feel they look great with nice jeans. They definitely are not basketball supported or athletic in any way. Grip on the bottom it's not good for any smooth hard surface because they don't grip. They are for dress only.
customer_reviews.author: redrock435

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: This is the pair of training shoes I’ve been waiting for. The fit is perfect; that is, snug enough and flat enough to provide firm support on leg day — but forgiving enough to be perfectly comfortable. The ankle support is so good you could put blades on them and skate. And they look cool as hell, but that’s just gravy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Great looks.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes look really great. Offer good support, although probably not the best choice for the gym. Overall I’m very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Michal Bloch

customer_reviews.title: Great for training
customer_reviews.text: Cool looking shoes, great fit for gym, training, cross-fit. Wide foot bed and not too much cushion. The tongue makes it a little hard to get into at first, but gets easier.
customer_reviews.author: Peter P Radawiec

customer_reviews.title: Fitting shoes, so don't tighten too tight
customer_reviews.text: Breaking in the shoes the first couple days were uncomfortable but gets better once you adjust them and loosen them up.
customer_reviews.author: Shae

customer_reviews.title: Do not read the review
customer_reviews.text: Maybe, just maybe a good looking shoe, it depends on what you like. I saw the pictures and got interested into but, true been told, most uncomfortable shoe. It get caught in your ankles and hurts like damn. It have the same sole of the UA ProjectRock. Love your money and don’t waste it.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Guerra

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but not great.
customer_reviews.text: I like them but they feel hard when it comes to cushioning. I tried a pair on at the UA store and they felt softer. But I still work out in them so 🤷🏾‍♂️.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Workout Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great for the gym; squats, dead lifting and other weight training. Not recommended for long distance running; keep using your running shoes for that. Other than this these shoes do not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great style but too narrow !!!
customer_reviews.text: The sneaker is very fashionable and looks cool but I wear a size 13 and it is very narrow, such that I can’t even zip it up. And it really hits to wear it for any amount of time. This is too bad because I actually really love the styling.
customer_reviews.author: Ndubuisi Azuogu

customer_reviews.title: Good lifting shoe
customer_reviews.text: The sole is pretty solid on this shoe. It takes a few workouts to break them in.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking just tight
customer_reviews.text: Foot won’t allow for the shoe to fully zip up
customer_reviews.author: Jimi 4 Life

customer_reviews.title: SMALLER THAN EXPECTED
customer_reviews.text: SURPRISED THAT FIT WAS SO SMALL - HAD TO RETURN
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Geibel

customer_reviews.title: Nice!!! Nice!!! Nice!!!
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t dislike anything, shoe turns heads everywhere. Only use them for show on Fridays, Freaking glad I dumped Nike!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not your ordinary shoe!!!
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are amazing fit (compression). They are perfect for working out!
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Sarmiento

customer_reviews.title: People need to know what they are buying...it’s a weightlifting shoe!
customer_reviews.text: People need to do some research into what they buy! These are weight training shoes. They are not built for walk around comfort. They are not a running shoe. The hard midsole has a purpose and that’s to support heavy lifts such as deadlifts and squats. That is the purpose of this shoe. If you bought this shoe because it looked cool and you don’t like how it feels, maybe you should leave a bad review of yourself and lack of knowledge. It’s a good shoe for it’s purpose. It’s not great and there are better pure weightlifting shoes but it’s a good entry into a weightlifting shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rodriguez

product_meta.title: Under Armour Men's Architech Futurist Sneaker
product_meta.description: UA SpeedForm upper molds perfectly to your foot to deliver zero distractions. Constructed with premium, microfiber synthetic leather. Perforations throughout upper for enhanced breathability & ventilation. Compression lace system with center-placed ¼ zipper for a tailored fit & seamless feel. Apparel inspired, external sleeve wraps around the midfoot up to the ankle for extended support & a dynamic fit. Debossed UNDER ARMOUR wordmark around the heel. Full-length Micro G midsole provides a stable platform, built for versatile performance. TPU injected heel clip provides a stable platform for stability during strength training & lifting. Rubber outsole pods with rounded, mini-lug pattern for excellent traction & durability. Non-removable insole.
feature_bullets: UA SpeedForm upper molds perfectly to your foot to deliver zero distractions
Constructed with premium, microfiber synthetic leather
Perforations throughout upper for enhanced breathability & ventilation
Compression lace system with center placed ¼ zipper for a tailored fit & seamless feel
Apparel inspired, external sleeve wraps around the midfoot up to the ankle for extended support & a dynamic fit
